title: Hot German Potato Salad Recipe
description: This hot German potato salad recipe is packed with flavor thanks to the addition of crispy bacon, tender onions, sugar, vinegar, and black pepper.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Potato Salad Recipes No Mayo Hot German Potato Salad 4.6 (1,001) 805 Reviews 53 Photos This hot German potato salad with bacon and onions is a delicious variation of traditional potato salad. Submitted by Tequila Updated on August 28, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 53 53 53 53 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 9 potatoes, peeled 6 slices bacon ¾ cup chopped onions 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons salt ½ teaspoon celery seed ⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper ¾ cup water ⅓ cup distilled white vinegar Directions Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain, cool, and slice thin. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside, reserving drippings. Sauté onions in bacon drippings over medium heat until they are golden brown. Whisk flour, sugar, salt, celery seed, and pepper together in a small bowl; stir into onions and cook until bubbling, then remove from heat. Stir in water and vinegar; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, and simmer for one minute. Gently stir bacon and sliced potatoes into the onion mixture until potatoes are heated through. DeDe I Made It Print 1,065 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 205 Calories 7g Fat 33g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 205 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 8% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Cholesterol 10mg 3% Sodium 512mg 22% Total Carbohydrate 33g 12% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 4g Protein 4g 9% Vitamin C 11mg 13% Calcium 17mg 1% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 518mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Hot German Potato Salad 01 of 53 Photo by  DeDe 02 of 53 Photo by  IndigoMug1741 08/04/2023 I used 4 strips of thick deli-bacon, red onions and cider vinegar because that’s what I had on-hand. I substituted in 1 tsp of celery salt & 1 tsp of sea salt because I had no celery seeds. Yukon gold potatoes had the right consistency. Very tasty and I will make this again. 03 of 53 Photo by  SmartFlan9845 05/17/2023 04 of 53 Photo by  Mary Kohr 06/04/2022 This is very good but I doctor it a little. I add a shot of Dijon mustard and chopped garlic. I uniformly cut up the potatoes before boiling. doesn't take as long to cook and not handling hot potatoes. 05 of 53 Photo by  Bill Mulholland 04/20/2021 German potato salad, has been a long time favorite of mine, enjoyed it from the time of childhood, the recipe here is the same as my Mother's. I just made it again, absolutely sooooo delicious. It's so good warm when just made, actually seems to get better with a day or so in the fridge. I used very lean bacon, and a bit more than the recipe calls for. 06 of 53 Photo by  Hgr 11/10/2020 Apple cider vinegar (doubled), chicken broth instead of water, and added celery. Sliced potatoes before boiling, of course. 10 star 07 of 53 Photo by  Cheryl Becker 03/09/2020 Excellent, I used cider vinegar and brown potatoes because that’s what I had in hand. This is a keeper! 08 of 53 Photo by  Bubber 07/03/2019 09 of 53 Photo by  Kari 06/08/2019 I added like 1 more TB of flour, and a few more strips of bacon and almost a cup of vinegar. (Have to taste the vinegar to me) But everyone loved it. Will be definitely be making this recipe again. Thank you 10 of 53 Photo by  jeandcar 01/19/2019 Very good! I didn't have bacon so diced some smoked sausage. Also didn't have celery seed so used celery salt. We really enjoyed it. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love German Potato Salad 422 Ratings Hot German Potato Salad I 13 Ratings Oktoberfest Potato Salad 28 Ratings Hot German Potato Salad II 13 Ratings Pipirrana (Spanish Potato Salad) 22 Ratings Liege Style Salad 14 Ratings Schwabischer Kartoffelsalat (German Potato Salad - Swabian-Style) 18 Ratings Brian's German Potato Salad 32 Ratings French Potato Salad 28 Ratings Potato Salad With Bacon, Olives, and Radishes 58 Ratings Russian Beet and Potato Salad 51 Ratings Mom's Russian Potato Salad 4 Ratings Mom's Italian Potato Salad 14 Ratings Italian Potato Salad 60 Ratings Yucatan Potato Salad 11 Ratings Restaurant-Style Potato Salad 386 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Tequila
instructions: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain, cool, and slice thin.;Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside, reserving drippings.;Sauté onions in bacon drippings over medium heat until they are golden brown.;Whisk flour, sugar, salt, celery seed, and pepper together in a small bowl; stir into onions and cook until bubbling, then remove from heat. Stir in water and vinegar; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, and simmer for one minute. Gently stir bacon and sliced potatoes into the onion mixture until potatoes are heated through. DeDe
